include/iinchip_conf.h File Reference

Detailed Description

W5300 Configuration & Defintions

This file defines some compile options of the W5300 program and code dependency of a target host system.

Compile option of the \b W5300 program

  • __DEF_IINCHIP_DBG__
    If it is defined, Some debug code is involved in the W5300 program.
  • __DEF_IINCHIP_INT__
    If it is defined, ISR routine is involved in the W5300 program.
  • __DEF_IINCHIP_PPP__
    If it is defined, PPP service routines is involved in the W5300 program. Also two files("md5.h" and "md5.c") are included in it.
  • MAX_SOCK_NUM
    It determines the SOCKET count of W5300.

Code dependency of a target host system

  • __DEF_IINCHIP_ADDRESS_MODE__
    It is used to decide to W5300 host interface mode. It must be defined with one in the following definitions.
    1. __DEF_IINCHIP_DIRECT_MODE__ : when direct mode
    2. __DEF_IINCHIP_INDIRECT_MODE__ : when indirect mode
  • __DEF_IINCHIP_MAP_BASE__
    It is determined the base address of W5300.
    You must define it as the physical address of your target host system.
    1. COMMON_REG_BASE : It is the base address of COMMON registers.
    2. SOCKET_REG_BASE : It is the base address of SOCKET registers.
  • __DEF_IINCHIP_BUF_OP__
    It define how to access to the intenal TX/RX memory of W5300.
    1. __DEF_C__ : Using C code
    2. __DEF_MCU_DEP_INLINE_ASM__ : Using inline ASM code
    3. __DEF_MCU_DEP_DMA__ : Using DMA controller
  • IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_ENTER() : Enter a critical section
  • IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_EXIT() : Exit a crtical section

Definition in file iinchip_conf.h.

Go to the source code of this file.

Defines

#define __DEF_IINCHIP_DBG__
#define __DEF_IINCHIP_INT__
#define __DEF_IINCHIP_PPP__
#define MAX_SOCK_NUM   8
#define __DEF_IINCHIP_DIRECT_MODE__   1
#define __DEF_IINCHIP_INDIRECT_MODE__   2
#define __DEF_IINCHIP_ADDRESS_MODE__   __DEF_IINCHIP_DIRECT_MODE__
#define __DEF_IINCHIP_MAP_BASE__   0x08000000
 Define the base address of W5300 on your target host system.
#define COMMON_REG_BASE   __DEF_IINCHIP_MAP_BASE__
#define SOCKET_REG_BASE   __DEF_IINCHIP_MAP_BASE__ + 0x0200
#define __DEF_C__   0
#define __DEF_MCU_DEP_INLINE_ASM__   1
#define __DEF_MCU_DEP_DMA__   2
#define __DEF_IINCHIP_BUF_OP__   __DEF_C__
#define IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_ENTER()   {}
 Enter a critical section.
#define IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_EXIT()   {}
 Exit a critical section.

#define __DEF_C__   0

Using C code

Definition at line 100 of file iinchip_conf.h.

#define __DEF_IINCHIP_ADDRESS_MODE__   __DEF_IINCHIP_DIRECT_MODE__

It is used to decide to W5300 host interface mode.

Note:
If you use W5300 with indirect mode, you define as the following. 
 #define  __DEF_IINCHIP_ADDRESS_MODE__    __DEF_IINCHIP_INDIRECT_MODE__

Definition at line 64 of file iinchip_conf.h.

#define __DEF_IINCHIP_BUF_OP__   __DEF_C__

It define how to access to the intenal TX/RX memory of W5300.

  • __DEF_C__
    Generally, Implements to use C code.
  • __DEF_MCU_DEP_INLINE_ASM__
    Implements to use inline ASM code
  • __DEF_MCU_DEP_DMA__
    Implements to use DMA controller

See also:
iinchip_write_buf(), iinchip_read_buf();
Todo:
__DEF_MCU_DEP_XXX__
If you define __DEF_MCU_DEP_XXX, You should do implement the code to access internal TX/RX memory of W5300.
Because the code is dependant on your MCU & compiler.

Definition at line 42 of file iinchip_conf.h.

#define __DEF_IINCHIP_MAP_BASE__   0x08000000

Define the base address of W5300 on your target host system.

It is used to define to base address of W5300 registers .

  • In direct mode, 
       #define COMMON_REG_BASE   __DEF_IINCHIP_MAP_BASE__ 
   #define SOCKET_REG_BASE   __DEF_IINCHIP_MAP_BASE__ + 0x0200
  • In indirect mode, 
       #define COMMON_REG_BASE     0 
   #define SOCKET_REG_BASE     0x0200

Todo:
__DEF_IINCHIP_MAP_BASE__ should be defined as your specified physical address value instead of '0x0800000'.

Definition at line 88 of file iinchip_conf.h.

 
#define IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_ENTER (  )     {}

Enter a critical section.

It is provided to protect your shared code which are executed without distribution.

In non-OS environment, It can be just implemented by disabling whole interrupt.
In OS environment, You can replace it to critical section api supported by OS.

See also:
IINCHIP_READ(), IINCHIP_WRITE(), getSn_TX_FSR(), getSn_RX_RSR()

IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_EXIT()

Todo:
You should do implement that is suitable in your MCU & compiler.

Definition at line 138 of file iinchip_conf.h.

Referenced by iinchip_irq(), IINCHIP_READ(), IINCHIP_WRITE(), wiz_read_buf(), and wiz_write_buf().

 
#define IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_EXIT (  )     {}

Exit a critical section.

It is provided to protect your shared code which are executed without distribution.

In non-OS environment, It can be just implemented by disabling whole interrupt.
In OS environment, You can replace it to critical section api supported by OS.

See also:
IINCHIP_READ(), IINCHIP_WRITE(), getSn_TX_FSR(), getSn_RX_RSR()

IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_ENTER()

Todo:
You should do implement that is suitable in your MCU & compiler.
